strong.span: for the rest of the school year

br.span: Thursday, April 23 update from Superintendent Russell - click
Wednesday, April 29 will be a TAB day
Friday, June 5 - Last day of school

span.style: font-size: medium; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(63, 63, 63);

br.br: Governor Sununu declared that all public schools in NH will continue remote learning for the rest of the school year.

br.span: During this time, teachers and staff are working remotely to support students and the needs of the Hudson community.
School buildings and the Superintendent's Office are closed. Please contact your child's teacher or the school if you need anything.

strong.span: Extended Closure Breakfast Lunch Pick Up Program

br.span:
Grab and Go Lunches are distributed from Hudson Memorial School on Mondays and Thursdays from 10:30 1:00.
On Mondays, students will receive lunches for Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday and on Thursdays they will receive lunches for Thursday and Friday as well as the weekend backpacks.

p.span:
The Missionof the Hudson School District is to:
Innovative learning practices and empowered educators facilitate and inspire learners to achieve personal academic excellence in a safe and dynamic environment that elevates their engagement as valued active community members.
